Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CP1(1-29) (fragment of cecropin P1; synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (93.55%) toCecropin P1.   K: 17%; V=A=S: 14%. GRAVY: -0.38; M Wt: 3085.582; M formula: C136H236N39O41, mol ex coeff: 5550.Activity: active against E. coli BL21 (MBC 0.05 uM), E. coli ML35 (MBC 0.2 uM), and L. innocua (MBC 2.4 uM).Structure:  NMR studies revealed a helical structure (rigid, N15 NOE).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.SAR: activity is similar to the intact parent peptide.  Also refer to AP134 via the similarity link above.
Literature Information.Author: Gu H, Kato T, Kumeta H, Kumaki Y, Tsukamoto T, Kikukawa T, Demura M, Ishida H, Vogel HJ, Aizawa T.2022
Literature Information.Title: Three-Dimensional Structure of the Antimicrobial Peptide Cecropin P1 in Dodecylphosphocholine Micelles and the Role of the C-Terminal Residues.
